result.execSummary:
The defendant William Anthony Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Absolutely no contact with victim Sukima D. unless authorized by DOC or the Court.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF1586.
*10/21/2015  Term of Extended Supervision commuted to five (5) years.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may not carrry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Anthony Jackson

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed
Decision and Order Denying DOC Request to Correct Sentence Credit, signed and filed. LNN
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to review JOC for excessive sentence credit

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AMENDING Judgments of Conviction signed and filed.
The term of extended supervision in 15CF1586 and 15CF2202 is commuted to five years.  All other sentencing orders entered on 9-22-2015 shall remain in full force and effect.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of extended supervision in 15CF001586 and 15CF002202.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements by state, defense, defendant and additional statement by Sukimi D.
As to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, concurrent with 15CF1586, credit for 156 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM, Sukima D unless authorized by Department of Corrections or the court.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and is to advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed: Pretrial Credit and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. (Filed in 15CF1586)

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, the parties have reached a resolution. 
As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the jury trial date of 09/28/2015 vacated. 

Discussion regarding the defendant's communication privileges.  Court will not change the communication order.

Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's motion for joinder of 15CF1586 & 15CF2202 is GRANTED.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jeff Szcewski for Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant William Anthony Jackson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a status conference date.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffery Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Status Conference to address joinder and substitution. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant William Anthony Jackson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. For reasons placed on the record Defense counsel motioned the court to withdraw as counsel. GRANTED by the court. Defense counsel to advised SPD office to appoint new counsel, and turnover discovery to the state on 7/9/15 at 1:30 PM in branch 23. Case set for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Harris's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Attorney of Record received and filed.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Discussion regarding communication privileges. Court advised that there is NO restriction as to communication privileges between the defendant and Attorney Thomas E. Harris. Case 15CF2202 & 15CF1586 Case is adjourned for a status conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer James Fohr.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case adjourned for Arraignment in branch 23 with pending matter before the court. Defense requested to modify defendants in-custody restrictions Denied.  Arraignment scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sukimi D or her children

Defendant William Anthony Jackson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant William Anthony Jackson in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
